instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesnâ€™t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN_L: What is PCH_INTVRMEN_L? PCH_INTVRMEN_L is a signal that stands for Internal Voltage Regulator Enable. When pulled high, this signal enables the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must be pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H..

threads.title: Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
threads.message:
iMac Not turn on - Fan spins then stops - LED 2 blinks

Already change new power supply but problem same

RTC signals
<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL> - 3.2v
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL> - 3. 1v
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3v

threads.title: Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check if try to appear all voltages on the big coils.
Be sure no short on any.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
threads.message:
Already check big coil no short.. Smc bypass nothing happen.. Power 11.96v drop to 9.xxv then normal again

Led 2 blinking and fan spin and stop

Already change ram but problem same

threads.title: Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
threads.message:
"Power 11.96v drop to 9.xxv"
Please specify, <SIGNAL>12V_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL>, or <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL>???
You may have a problem with <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR>/70.

threads.title: Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
Imac A1419 cannot turn on 820 4652 A
threads.message: Already change <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR>.. Problem solved.. Imac normal again.. Thanks
